document.masterDocTitle: The lefteye flounder family Bothidae (Order Pleuronectiformes) of Taiwan

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The lefteye flounder family Bothidae (Order Pleuronectiformes) of Taiwan

tableCitation.captionText-0: TABLE 7. Frequency of dorsal- and anal- fin rays of nine Engyprosopon species in Taiwan. Data of E. xystrias are taken from other localities, except for one (marked by *) from Taiwan.
tableCitation.captionText-1: TABLE 8. Frequency of four meristic data of nine Engyprosopon species in Taiwan. Data of E. xystrias are taken from other localities, except for one (marked by *) from Taiwan.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Engyprosopon multisquama Amaoka, 1963b:111
( Type locality: Susaki, Kochi Prefecture , Japan ).
Synonymy as shown in Amaoka & Ho (2018) .
Specimens examined. As listed in Amaoka & Ho (2018) . Also other specimens in NMMB-P collection.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 8. Frequency of four meristic data of nine
Engyprosopon
species in Taiwan . Data of
E. xystrias
are taken from other localities, except for one (marked by *) from Taiwan .

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnostic features. D 89–98; A 68–75; P 10–12; C 3+11+3=17; LLs 45–50; GR 0+6–7=6–7; vert. 10+25– 26=35–36. Body narrowly ovate, greatest depth less than 53.5% SL; caudal fin with a pair of black blotches, arranged between the second and fourth fin rays from the uppermost and lowermost fin rays; pectoral fin on ocularside with greatly elongate filament, longer in males than females; gill rakers not serrate.
Size. Reaching 105 cm SL in Taiwan ; up to 137 mm SL in southern Japan ( Amaoka, 1969 ).
Distribution. Northeastern, western and southwestern Taiwan ; from southern Japan to possibly Mekong River (Amoaka, unpubl. data).
